OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupTinkersConstruct
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for Tinkers Construct Ores.

OptionChoice.name: enableTinkersConstruct
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Tinkers Construct ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Tinkers Construct ores.
Tinkers Construct ores will be handled by the mod itself.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpTinkersConstruct
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Tinkers Construct ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Tinkers Construct ores.
Tinkers Construct ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

OptionChoice.name: ticoCopperDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Copper is generated

Choice.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Copper is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: ticoCopperFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Tinkers Construct Copper distributions

OptionNumeric.name: ticoCopperSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Tinkers Construct Copper distributions

OptionChoice.name: ticoMountainCopperDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Mountain Copper is generated

Choice.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Mountain Copper is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: ticoMountainCopperSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Tinkers Construct Mountain Copper distributions

Substitute.name: ticoOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Substitute.name: ticoOverworldBlockSubstitute1
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: ticoCopperVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Cloud.name: ticoCopperCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: ticoCopperHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: ticoCopperStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Veins.name: ticoCobaltHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: ticoCobaltStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.name: ticoArditeVeins
Veins.Description: Small motherlodes without any branches. Similar to the deposits produced by StandardGen distributions.

Cloud.name: ticoArditeCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.
